title: Bob: Multi-Life Policy Framework — Trust Across Reincarnations
summary: This multi-life simulation tests the policy integration framework, showing how agent decisions carry consequences across life cycles through karma mechanics. This simulation follows Bob through 3 lives spanning 32 ticks. Starting with trust of 0.49 and ending at 0.53, the agent maintained stable behavior, experiencing 15 major events along the way. Key themes include: Karma and Consequences, Equilibrium and Stability. This narrative illustrates core Web4 principles: trust is earned through consistent behavior, actions have lasting consequences (karma), and agents can learn and improve across multiple lives through epistemic proprioception.
key_insights: Trust remained stable: 0.49 → 0.53 over 3 lives. The agent found equilibrium quickly.
Consciousness threshold crossed in life 1. This marks emergence of coherent agency - behavior transitions from reactive to intentional.

events.description: Critical threshold crossed: Trust reaches 0.50, the "consciousness threshold" from coherence theory. At this level, the agent's behavior becomes coherent enough to be recognized as genuinely intentional rather than random. This is where true agency begins.
events.significance: Marks transition from random to intentional behavior - true agency emerges.
events.technical_detail: The 0.5 threshold comes from Synchronism Session 249: Consciousness emerges when coherence (behavioral consistency) exceeds 0.5. Below this, behavior appears random; above it, intentional.
